intro: Pelargonium alchemilloides var. dentatum, commonly known as the serrated geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive serrated leaf margins and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is a hardy perennial that is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine, though its primary appeal lies in its visual characteristics.
